attributes.action: Review the laws relating to driving and prescribed medical cannabis use
attributes.additional_details: Arguably medical cannabis users have an unfair right to be impaired whilst driving. This could place many people in danger from those that choose to medicate and take the wheel.
attributes.background: I want the government to investigate the impact on driving of prescribed medical cannabis because at the moment there are arguably a lot of people driving around impaired.

rejection.details: Under the Road Traffic Act 1988, individuals who are legally prescribed medical cannabis are allowed to drive as long as they adhere to their doctor’s guidance and are not impaired at the time of driving.
